026package org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.tool;
027
028import java.nio.file.Files;
029import java.nio.file.InvalidPathException;
030import java.nio.file.Paths;
031import java.util.ArrayList;
032import java.util.HashSet;
033import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
034import java.util.List;
035import java.util.Set;
036
037import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
038import javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind;
039import javax.tools.JavaFileObject;
040import javax.tools.StandardJavaFileManager;
041
042import com.sun.tools.javac.code.ClassFinder;
043import com.sun.tools.javac.code.DeferredCompletionFailureHandler;
044import com.sun.tools.javac.code.Symbol.Completer;
045import com.sun.tools.javac.code.Symbol.CompletionFailure;
046import com.sun.tools.javac.code.Symbol.PackageSymbol;
047import com.sun.tools.javac.comp.Enter;
048import com.sun.tools.javac.tree.JCTree;
049import com.sun.tools.javac.tree.JCTree.JCClassDecl;
050import com.sun.tools.javac.tree.JCTree.JCCompilationUnit;
051import com.sun.tools.javac.util.Abort;
052import com.sun.tools.javac.util.Context;
053import com.sun.tools.javac.util.ListBuffer;
054import com.sun.tools.javac.util.Position;
055import jdk.javadoc.doclet.DocletEnvironment;
056
057import static org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.tool.Main.Result.*;
058
059/**
060 * This class could be the main entry point for Javadoc when Javadoc is used as a
061 * component in a larger software system. It provides operations to
062 * construct a new javadoc processor, and to run it on a set of source
063 * files.
064 */
065public class JavadocTool extends com.sun.tools.javac.main.JavaCompiler {
066    ToolEnvironment toolEnv;
067
068    final JavadocLog log;
069    final ClassFinder javadocFinder;
070    final DeferredCompletionFailureHandler dcfh;
071    final Enter javadocEnter;
072    final Set<JavaFileObject> uniquefiles;
073
074    /**
075     * Construct a new JavaCompiler processor, using appropriately
076     * extended phases of the underlying compiler.
077     */
078    protected JavadocTool(Context context) {
079        super(context);
080        log = JavadocLog.instance0(context);
081        javadocFinder = JavadocClassFinder.instance(context);
082        dcfh = DeferredCompletionFailureHandler.instance(context);
083        javadocEnter = JavadocEnter.instance(context);
084        uniquefiles = new HashSet<>();
085    }
086
087    /**
088     * For javadoc, the parser needs to keep comments. Overrides method from JavaCompiler.
089     */
090    @Override
091    protected boolean keepComments() {
092        return true;
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * Construct a new javadoc tool.
097     */
098    public static JavadocTool make0(Context context) {
099        JavadocLog log = null;
100        try {
101            // force the use of Javadoc's class finder
102            JavadocClassFinder.preRegister(context);
103
104            // force the use of Javadoc's own enter phase
105            JavadocEnter.preRegister(context);
106
107            // force the use of Javadoc's own member enter phase
108            JavadocMemberEnter.preRegister(context);
109
110            // force the use of Javadoc's own todo phase
111            JavadocTodo.preRegister(context);
112
113            // force the use of Javadoc's subtype of Log
114            log = JavadocLog.instance0(context);
115
116            return new JavadocTool(context);
117        } catch (CompletionFailure ex) {
118            assert log != null;
119            log.error(Position.NOPOS, ex.getMessage());
120            return null;
121        }
122    }
123
124    public DocletEnvironment getEnvironment(ToolOptions toolOptions,
125            List<String> javaNames,
126            Iterable<? extends JavaFileObject> fileObjects)
127            throws ToolException {
128        toolEnv = ToolEnvironment.instance(context);
129        toolEnv.initialize(toolOptions);
130        ElementsTable etable = new ElementsTable(context, toolOptions);
131        javadocFinder.sourceCompleter = etable.xclasses
132            ? Completer.NULL_COMPLETER
133            : sourceCompleter;
134
135        if (etable.xclasses) {
136            // If -Xclasses is set, the args should be a list of class names
137            for (String arg : javaNames) {
138                if (!isValidPackageName(arg)) { // checks
139                    String text = log.getText("main.illegal_class_name", arg);
140                    throw new ToolException(CMDERR, text);
141                }
142            }
143            if (log.hasErrors()) {
144                return null;
145            }
146            etable.setClassArgList(javaNames);
147            // prepare, force the data structures to be analyzed
148            etable.analyze();
149            return new DocEnvImpl(toolEnv, etable);
150        }
151
152        ListBuffer<JCCompilationUnit> classTrees = new ListBuffer<>();
153
154        try {
155            StandardJavaFileManager fm
156                = toolEnv.fileManager instanceof StandardJavaFileManager sfm
157                    ? sfm
158                    : null;
159            Set<String> packageNames = new LinkedHashSet<>();
160            // Normally, the args should be a series of package names or file
161            // names.
162            // Parse the files and collect the package names.
163            for (String arg : javaNames) {
164                if (fm != null && arg.endsWith(".java") && isRegularFile(arg)) {
165                    parse(fm.getJavaFileObjects(arg), classTrees, true);
166                } else if (isValidPackageName(arg)) {
167                    packageNames.add(arg);
168                } else if (arg.endsWith(".java")) {
169                    if (fm == null) {
170                        String text
171                            = log.getText("main.assertion.error", "fm == null");
172                        throw new ToolException(ABNORMAL, text);
173                    } else {
174                        String text = log.getText("main.file_not_found", arg);
175                        throw new ToolException(ERROR, text);
176                    }
177                } else {
178                    String text = log.getText("main.illegal_package_name", arg);
179                    throw new ToolException(CMDERR, text);
180                }
181            }
182
183            // Parse file objects provide via the DocumentationTool API
184            parse(fileObjects, classTrees, true);
185
186            etable.packages(packageNames)
187                .classTrees(classTrees.toList())
188                .scanSpecifiedItems();
189
190            // abort, if errors were encountered during modules initialization
191            if (log.hasErrors()) {
192                return null;
193            }
194
195            // Parse the files in the packages and subpackages to be documented
196            ListBuffer<JCCompilationUnit> allTrees = new ListBuffer<>();
197            allTrees.addAll(classTrees);
198            parse(etable.getFilesToParse(), allTrees, false);
199            modules.newRound();
200            modules.initModules(allTrees.toList());
201
202            if (log.hasErrors()) {
203                return null;
204            }
205
206            // Enter symbols for all files
207            toolEnv.printInfo("main.Building_tree");
208            javadocEnter.main(allTrees.toList());
209
210            if (log.hasErrors()) {
211                return null;
212            }
213
214            etable.setClassDeclList(listClasses(classTrees.toList()));
215
216            dcfh.setHandler(dcfh.userCodeHandler);
217            etable.analyze();
218
219            // Ensure that package-info is read for all included packages
220            for (Element e : etable.getIncludedElements()) {
221                if (e.getKind() == ElementKind.PACKAGE) {
222                    PackageSymbol p = (PackageSymbol) e;
223                    if (p.package_info != null) {
224                        p.package_info.complete();
225                    }
226                }
227            }
228
229        } catch (CompletionFailure cf) {
230            throw new ToolException(ABNORMAL, cf.getMessage(), cf);
231        } catch (Abort abort) {
232            if (log.hasErrors()) {
233                // presumably a message has been emitted, keep silent
234                throw new ToolException(ABNORMAL, "", abort);
235            } else {
236                String text = log.getText("main.internal.error");
237                Throwable t
238                    = abort.getCause() == null ? abort : abort.getCause();
239                throw new ToolException(ABNORMAL, text, t);
240            }
241        }
242
243        if (log.hasErrors())
244            return null;
245
246        toolEnv.docEnv = new DocEnvImpl(toolEnv, etable);
247        return toolEnv.docEnv;
248    }
249
250    private boolean isRegularFile(String s) {
251        try {
252            return Files.isRegularFile(Paths.get(s));
253        } catch (InvalidPathException e) {
254            return false;
255        }
256    }
257
258    /** Is the given string a valid package name? */
259    boolean isValidPackageName(String s) {
260        if (s.contains("/")) {
261            String[] a = s.split("/");
262            if (a.length == 2) {
263                return isValidPackageName0(a[0]) && isValidPackageName0(a[1]);
264            }
265            return false;
266        }
267        return isValidPackageName0(s);
268    }
269
270    private boolean isValidPackageName0(String s) {
271        for (int index = s.indexOf('.'); index != -1; index = s.indexOf('.')) {
272            if (!isValidClassName(s.substring(0, index))) {
273                return false;
274            }
275            s = s.substring(index + 1);
276        }
277        return isValidClassName(s);
278    }
279
280    private void parse(Iterable<? extends JavaFileObject> files,
281            ListBuffer<JCCompilationUnit> trees,
282            boolean trace) {
283        for (JavaFileObject fo : files) {
284            if (uniquefiles.add(fo)) { // ignore duplicates
285                if (trace)
286                    toolEnv.printInfo("main.Loading_source_file", fo.getName());
287                trees.append(parse(fo));
288            }
289        }
290    }
291
292    /** Are surrogates supported? */
293    static final boolean surrogatesSupported = surrogatesSupported();
294
295    private static boolean surrogatesSupported() {
296        try {
297            boolean b = Character.isHighSurrogate('a');
298            return true;
299        } catch (NoSuchMethodError ex) {
300            return false;
301        }
302    }
303
304    /**
305     * Return true if given file name is a valid class name
306     * (including "package-info").
307     * @param s the name of the class to check.
308     * @return true if given class name is a valid class name
309     * and false otherwise.
310     */
311    public static boolean isValidClassName(String s) {
312        if (s.length() < 1)
313            return false;
314        if (s.equals("package-info"))
315            return true;
316        if (surrogatesSupported) {
317            int cp = s.codePointAt(0);
318            if (!Character.isJavaIdentifierStart(cp))
319                return false;
320            for (int j = Character.charCount(cp); j < s.length();
321                    j += Character.charCount(cp)) {
322                cp = s.codePointAt(j);
323                if (!Character.isJavaIdentifierPart(cp))
324                    return false;
325            }
326        } else {
327            if (!Character.isJavaIdentifierStart(s.charAt(0)))
328                return false;
329            for (int j = 1; j < s.length(); j++)
330                if (!Character.isJavaIdentifierPart(s.charAt(j)))
331                    return false;
332        }
333        return true;
334    }
335
336    /**
337     * From a list of top level trees, return the list of contained class definitions
338     */
339    List<JCClassDecl> listClasses(List<JCCompilationUnit> trees) {
340        List<JCClassDecl> result = new ArrayList<>();
341        for (JCCompilationUnit t : trees) {
342            for (JCTree def : t.defs) {
343                if (def.hasTag(JCTree.Tag.CLASSDEF))
344                    result.add((JCClassDecl) def);
345            }
346        }
347        return result;
348    }
349}
